snippet: "The Book of Mormon" topped the Broadway box office last week, thanks to premium ticket pricing and the fact that it remains in a relatively small theater.
abstract: "The Book of Mormon" topped the Broadway box office last week, thanks to premium ticket pricing and the fact that it remains in a relatively small theater.
lead_paragraph: After 11 months of performances on Broadway, "The Book of Mormon" reached a milestone last week in its extraordinary box office success fueled by premium ticket pricing: The musical beat the long-running blockbusters "Wicked" and "The Lion King" to become the top-grossing show in a single week for the first time, even though "Mormon" had hundreds of fewer seats to sell to each performance than those two other commercial hits.

headline.main: 'Book of Mormon' Tops Broadway Box Office For First Time
